title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on developing goals and objectives with employees. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires interactive instructor-based training for supervisors on various aspects of their roles, including developing goals with employees, managing performance, and understanding prohibited personnel practices. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates programs for supervisors to receive training on prohibited personnel practices and enforcement procedures. New supervisors must complete training within a year of appointment, and all supervisors must undergo training every three years. Mentoring programs are also established for experienced supervisors to guide new supervisors in various skills. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires supervisors to complete training programs every three years, with credit given for previous similar training. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for agency compliance. Regulations must be in place within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors every three years, with regulations to be prescribed by the Office of Personnel Management within 180 days of enactment. The amendments take effect 180 days after enactment, applying to new and existing supervisors who must complete training programs within 3 years. Supervisors must complete training programs every three years as mandated by the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006. Management competency standards are outlined in Section 3. Management competency standards are outlined in Section 3, with the Office of Personnel Management issuing guidance to agencies on the standards supervisors must meet to effectively manage employee performance. Each agency is required to develop performance assessment standards for supervisors, considering OPM guidance and other qualifications. Each agency must develop standards to assess supervisor performance, considering OPM guidance and other qualifications. They should evaluate supervisors' capacity to meet OPM guidance and implement a training program to address identified issues. Agencies must submit annual progress reports to OPM. Technical and conforming amendments are made to the table of sections for chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. Management competency standards are outlined in section 4305, with regulations in section 4306. A reference in section 4304(b)(3) of title 5, United States Code, is updated to reflect this change.
